intro: Valerianella rugulosa, commonly known as mouse-ear chickweed, is a small annual herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small white or pinkish flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in gardens. Its leaves are edible and have a slightly peppery taste, making it a minor herb in some cuisines. Valerianella rugulosa is also known for its ability to thrive in moist environments and its role in supporting local insect populations.
